item.title: pending-navigating the linux filesystem
item.description: Explained: Terminal(emulator), shell, command-line(prompt) The most effective way, and arguably the only way, of navigating and managing a linux system is through the linux terminal. The linux terminal is the enviroment that provides the user interaction to the system via the shell. Shells are little programs, that come in various flavors, which processes the interaction between the user and system. Examples: BASH, zsh, SH, csh, ksh… etc A command-line is where your cursor sits and where you type.
item.dc:creator: Matt Raupfer
